name: Poly Resonator
description: This algorithm is a polysynth where each voice is essentially a Rings (the open source Rings https://github.com/pichenettes/eurorack/tree/master/rings) [93] module by Émilie Gillet. Rings itself does support a kind of polyphony, but it’s limited by having a single pitch and gate input – it’s very much designed so that only one note is triggered at a time. This algorithm gives you a full Rings implementation for each voice, with the convenience of shared parameter control. Please refer to the section “Common polysynth features” above.

parameters.name: Synth effect
parameters.description: If the mode is 'Synth', selects the audio effect applied to the synth output.

parameters.name: Resolution
parameters.description: Sets the resolution of the resonators. See above.

parameters.name: Chord
parameters.description: Chooses the chord to use for resonator modes that use one. In the original, set from the Structure knob.

parameters.name: Noise gate
parameters.description: Enables a noise gate on the audio input. Always enabled in the original Rings.

parameters.name: Input gain
parameters.description: A gain applied to the input audio, before it hits the resonator.

parameters.name: Audio input
parameters.description: Chooses which input bus to use for the audio input.

parameters.name: Odd output
parameters.description: The bus to use for the Odd output.

parameters.name: Even output
parameters.description: The bus to use for the Even output.

parameters.name: Odd output mode
parameters.description: The Add/Replace mode for the Odd output.

parameters.name: Even output mode
parameters.description: The Add/Replace mode for the Even output.

parameters.name: Output gain
parameters.description: The output level (of both the Odd and Even outputs).

parameters.name: Dry gain
parameters.description: The level of the input audio mixed into the output(s).
